% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{M1=M2; C1=C2; P1=P2}=0 :- match(M1,C1,P1), match(M2,C2,P2), (M1,C1,P1)!=(M2,C2,P2).

% 1. Hannah paid more than Teri's client.
P1>P2 :- match(M1,C1,P1), match(M2,C2,P2), C1="Hannah", M2="Teri".

% 2. Freda paid 20 dollars more than Lynda's client.
P1=P2+20 :- match(M1,C1,P1), match(M2,C2,P2), C1="Freda", M2="Lynda".

% 3. Hannah paid 10 dollars less than Nancy's client.
P1+10=P2 :- match(M1,C1,P1), match(M2,C2,P2), C1="Hannah", M2="Nancy".

% 4. Nancy's client, Hannah and Ginger were all different clients.
C1!=C2 :- match(M1,C1,P1), match(M2,C2,P2), match(M3,C3,P3), M1="Nancy", C2="Hannah", C3="Ginger".
C2!=C3 :- match(M1,C1,P1), match(M2,C2,P2), match(M3,C3,P3), M1="Nancy", C2="Hannah", C3="Ginger".
C1!=C3 :- match(M1,C1,P1), match(M2,C2,P2), match(M3,C3,P3), M1="Nancy", C2="Hannah", C3="Ginger".

% 5. Hannah was either the person who paid $180 or Lynda's client.
{P=180; M="Lynda"}=1 :- match(M,C,P), C="Hannah".

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{D1=D2; M1=M2; Du1=Du2}=0 :- assign_diplomat(D1,M1,Du1), assign_diplomat(D2,M2,Du2), (D1,M1,Du1)!=(D2,M2,Du2).

% 1. Vasquez will leave sometime after Macdonald.
M1<M2 :- assign_diplomat(D1,M1,Du1), assign_diplomat(D2,M2,Du2), D1="Macdonald", D2="Vasquez".

% 2. Vasquez will leave 1 month before the ambassador with the 5 day visit.
M1=M2-1 :- assign_diplomat(D1,M1,Du1), assign_diplomat(D2,M2,Du2), D1="Vasquez", Du2=5.

% 3. Gilbert is either the person leaving in January or the ambassador with the 4 day visit.
{M=1; Du=4}=1 :- assign_diplomat(D,M,Du), D="Gilbert".

% 4. Macdonald will leave 1 month before the ambassador with the 4 day visit.
M1=M2-1 :- assign_diplomat(D1,M1,Du1), assign_diplomat(D2,M2,Du2), D1="Macdonald", Du2=4.

% 5. The ambassador with the 4 day visit will leave sometime before the ambassador with the 9 day visit.
M1<M2 :- assign_diplomat(D1,M1,Du1), assign_diplomat(D2,M2,Du2), Du1=4, Du2=9.

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{N1=N2; M1=M2; C1=C2}=0 :- match(N1,M1,C1), match(N2,M2,C2), (N1,M1,C1)!=(N2,M2,C2).

% 1. The Worul, the rocket that will launch in February and the rocket that will launch in January are all different rockets.
N1!=N2 :- match(N1,M1,C1), match(N2,M2,C2), N1="Worul", M2=2.
N1!=N3 :- match(N1,M1,C1), match(N3,M3,C3), N1="Worul", M3=1.
M2!=M3 :- match(N2,M2,C2), match(N3,M3,C3), M2=2, M3=1.

% 2. The Dreadco is made by Ubersplore.
C="Ubersplore" :- match(N,M,C), N="Dreadco".

% 3. The rocket developed by Permias will launch 1 month before the Foltron.
M1=M2-1 :- match(N1,M1,C1), match(N2,M2,C2), C1="Permias", N2="Foltron".

% 4. The rocket that will launch in January is made by Techtrin.
C="Techtrin" :- match(N,M,C), M=1.

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{W1=W2; D1=D2; T1=T2}=0 :- match(W1,D1,T1), match(W2,D2,T2), (W1,D1,T1)!=(W2,D2,T2).

% 1. The report from Zearing was either the August 4 report or Edith Estes's report.
{D=4; W="Edith Estes"}=1 :- match(W,D,T), T="Zearing".

% 2. Hal Harrison's report was submitted sometime after Iva Ingram's sighting.
D1>D2 :- match(W1,D1,T1), match(W2,D2,T2), W1="Hal Harrison", W2="Iva Ingram".

% 3. The August 5 sighting was from Islesboro.
T="Islesboro" :- match(W,D,T), D=5.

% 4. The report from Tarzana was submitted 1 day before the sighting from Islesboro.
D1=D2-1 :- match(W1,D1,T1), match(W2,D2,T2), T1="Tarzana", T2="Islesboro".

% 5. Benny Baron's report was received on August 7.
D=7 :- match(W,D,T), W="Benny Baron".

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{N1=N2; A1=A2; W1=W2; L1=L2}=0 :- assign_condor(N1,A1,W1,L1), assign_condor(N2,A2,W2,L2), (N1,A1,W1,L1)!=(N2,A2,W2,L2).

% 1. Sunshine is either the condor with a wingspan of 102 inches or the 5-year-old bird.
{W=102; A=5}=1 :- assign_condor(N,A,W,L), N="Sunshine".

% 2. The condor with a wingspan of 114 inches is 5 years old.
A=5 :- assign_condor(N,A,W,L), W=114.

% 3. Pepper has a wingspan of 114 inches.
W=114 :- assign_condor(N,A,W,L), N="Pepper".

% 4. The four condors are the 9-year-old bird, Pepper, Merlin and the condor with a wingspan of 106 inches.
{A=9; N="Pepper"; N="Merlin"; W=106}=1 :- assign_condor(N,A,W,L).

% 5. The 9-year-old bird has a wingspan 4 inches shorter than the 4-year-old bird.
W1=W2-4 :- assign_condor(N1,A1,W1,L1), assign_condor(N2,A2,W2,L2), A1=9, A2=4.

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{G1=G2; D1=D2; M1=M2}=0 :- match_game_to_developer_and_month(G1,D1,M1), match_game_to_developer_and_month(G2,D2,M2), (G1,D1,M1)!=(G2,D2,M2).

% 1. The app released by Vortia was released 2 months later than Flowcarts.
M1=M2+2 :- match_game_to_developer_and_month(G1,D1,M1), match_game_to_developer_and_month(G2,D2,M2), D1="Vortia", G2="Flowcarts".

% 2. Angry Ants was released 3 months later than the app released by Gadingo.
M1=M2+3 :- match_game_to_developer_and_month(G1,D1,M1), match_game_to_developer_and_month(G2,D2,M2), G1="Angry Ants", D2="Gadingo".

% 3. The game released by Apptastic was released 3 months later than Flowcarts.
M1=M2+3 :- match_game_to_developer_and_month(G1,D1,M1), match_game_to_developer_and_month(G2,D2,M2), D1="Apptastic", G2="Flowcarts".

% 4. The game released by Novio is either the game released in July or Bubble Bombs.
{M=7; G="Bubble Bombs"}=1 :- match_game_to_developer_and_month(G,D,M), D="Novio".

% 5. Peter Parka is either the app released by Novio or the game released in May.
{D="Novio"; M=5}=1 :- match_game_to_developer_and_month(G,D,M), G="Peter Parka".

% 6. The game released in July was made by Apptastic.
D="Apptastic" :- match_game_to_developer_and_month(G,D,M), M=7.

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{W1=W2; V1=V2; T1=T2}=0 :- match(W1,V1,T1), match(W2,V2,T2), (W1,V1,T1)!=(W2,V2,T2).

% 1. The Luzagueil is a chardonnay.
T="chardonnay" :- match(W,V,T), W="Luzagueil".

% 2. The Annata Branco is either the 1992 wine or the syrah.
{V=1992; T="syrah"}=1 :- match(W,V,T), W="Annata Branco".

% 3. The Friambliss is a syrah.
T="syrah" :- match(W,V,T), W="Friambliss".

% 4.1 The pinot gris and the 1984 bottle are different.
{W="pinot gris"; V=1984}=0 :- match(W,V,T).

% 4.2 The pinot gris is the Luzagueil or the Zifennwein.
{T="pinot gris"}=1 :- match(W,V,T), (W="Luzagueil"; W="Zifennwein").

% 4.3 The 1984 bottle is the Luzagueil or the Zifennwein.
{V=1984}=1 :- match(W,V,T), (W="Luzagueil"; W="Zifennwein").

% 5. The pinot gris was bottled 4 years after the merlot.
V1=V2+4 :- match(W1,V1,T1), match(W2,V2,T2), T1="pinot gris", T2="merlot".

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{W1=W2; D1=D2; T1=T2}=0 :- match(W1,D1,T1), match(W2,D2,T2), (W1,D1,T1)!=(W2,D2,T2).

% 1. Benny Baron's sighting was submitted 2 days after Dan Delgado's report.
D1=D2+2 :- match(W1,D1,T1), match(W2,D2,T2), W1="Benny Baron", W2="Dan Delgado".

% 2.1 The August 7 report and the August 5 sighting are different.
D1!=D2 :- match(W1,D1,T1), match(W2,D2,T2), D1=7, D2=5.

% 2.2 The August 7 report was reported by Gil Gates or was from Walnut Creek.
{W="Gil Gates"; T="Walnut Creek"}=1 :- match(W,D,T), D=7.

% 2.3 The August 5 sighting was reported by Gil Gates or was from Walnut Creek.
{W="Gil Gates"; T="Walnut Creek"}=1 :- match(W,D,T), D=5.

% 3. The report from Crescent City was submitted 1 day after the sighting from Islesboro.
D1=D2+1 :- match(W1,D1,T1), match(W2,D2,T2), T1="Crescent City", T2="Islesboro".

% 4. The sighting from Walnut Creek was either the August 7 report or Edith Estes's sighting.
{D=7; W="Edith Estes"}=1 :- match(W,D,T), T="Walnut Creek".

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{C1=C2; D1=D2; S1=S2}=0 :- match(C1,D1,S1), match(C2,D2,S2), (C1,D1,S1)!=(C2,D2,S2).

% 1. The Leden drove 25 miles farther than the automobile with a high speed of 75 MPH.
D1=D2+25 :- match(C1,D1,S1), match(C2,D2,S2), C1="Leden", S2=75.

% 2. The Poltris drove 25 miles farther than the automobile with a high speed of 69 MPH.
D1=D2+25 :- match(C1,D1,S1), match(C2,D2,S2), C1="Poltris", S2=69.

% 3. The Awick drove somewhat less than the automobile with a high speed of 81 MPH.
D1<D2 :- match(C1,D1,S1), match(C2,D2,S2), C1="Awick", S2=81.

% 4. The car with a high speed of 69 MPH drove somewhat farther than the automobile with a high speed of 81 MPH.
D1>D2 :- match(C1,D1,S1), match(C2,D2,S2), S1=69, S2=81.

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{W1=W2; H1=H2; C1=C2}=0 :- match(W1,H1,C1), match(W2,H2,C2), (W1,H1,C1)!=(W2,H2,C2).

% 1. The 115 ft tall waterfall is either the waterfall in Nigeria or the waterfall located in Tibet.
{C="Nigeria"; C="Tibet"}=1 :- match(W,H,C), H=115.

% 2. Inawatai is 100 ft tall.
H=100 :- match(W,H,C), W="Inawatai".

% 3. Nyalt is 10 ft taller than Rhoqua.
H1=H2+10 :- match(W1,H1,C1), match(W2,H2,C2), W1="Nyalt", W2="Rhoqua".

% 4. The waterfall in Brazil is somewhat shorter than Rhoqua.
H1<H2 :- match(W1,H1,C1), match(W2,H2,C2), C1="Brazil", W2="Rhoqua".

% 5. The waterfall in Brazil is 10 ft shorter than the waterfall located in Nigeria.
H1=H2-10 :- match(W1,H1,C1), match(W2,H2,C2), C1="Brazil", C2="Nigeria".

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{N1=N2; PS1=PS2; B1=B2}=0 :- match(N1,PS1,B1), match(N2,PS2,B2), (N1,PS1,B1)!=(N2,PS2,B2).

% 1. Arthur's pack is either the 25 liter pack or the Adironda pack.
{PS=25; B="Adironda"}=1 :- match(N,PS,B), N="Arthur".

% 2. Eugene's pack is made by Adironda.
B="Adironda" :- match(N,PS,B), N="Eugene".

% 3. Natasha's pack is either the 40 liter pack or the Travelore pack.
{PS=40; B="Travelore"}=1 :- match(N,PS,B), N="Natasha".

% 4. Natasha's pack is 10 liters larger than the Grennel pack.
PS1=PS2+10 :- match(N1,PS1,B1), match(N2,PS2,B2), N1="Natasha", B2="Grennel".

% 5. The 30 liter pack is made by Grennel.
B="Grennel" :- match(N,PS,B), PS=30.

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{M1=M2; O1=O2; C1=C2}=0 :- match(M1,O1,C1), match(M2,O2,C2), (M1,O1,C1)!=(M2,O2,C2).

% 1. The prospector who found 11 ounces of gold was either the prospector working at Fuller Rise or the prospector working at Culver Gorge.
{C="Fuller Rise"; C="Culver Gorge"}=1 :- match(M,O,C), O=11.

% 2. The prospector who found 20 ounces of gold worked at the Fuller Rise claim.
C="Fuller Rise" :- match(M,O,C), O=20.

% 3. Ivan Ingram found 14 ounces of gold.
O=14 :- match(M,O,C), M="Ivan Ingram".

% 4. The miner working at Belle Hart finished with 6 ounces more gold than Fred Fletcher.
O1=O2+6 :- match(M1,O1,C1), match(M2,O2,C2), C1="Belle Hart", M2="Fred Fletcher".

% 5. Jack Jacobs finished with somewhat less gold than Gil Gonzalez.
O1<O2 :- match(M1,O1,C1), match(M2,O2,C2), M1="Jack Jacobs", M2="Gil Gonzalez".

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{E1=E2; R1=R2; S1=S2}=0 :- assign_employee_to_ride_and_section(E1,R1,S1), assign_employee_to_ride_and_section(E2,R2,S2), (E1,R1,S1)!=(E2,R2,S2).

% 1. Herbert served 25 fewer riders than Marc.
R1=R2-25 :- assign_employee_to_ride_and_section(E1,R1,S1), assign_employee_to_ride_and_section(E2,R2,S2), E1="Herbert", E2="Marc".

% 2. The worker who served 125 riders works in the red section.
S="red" :- assign_employee_to_ride_and_section(E,R,S), R=125.

% 3.1 The person who works in the pink section and the person who served 100 riders are different.
S1!=S2 :- assign_employee_to_ride_and_section(E1,R1,S1), assign_employee_to_ride_and_section(E2,R2,S2), S1="pink", R2=100.

% 3.2 The person who works in the pink section is Herbert or Marc.
{E="Herbert"; E="Marc"}=1 :- assign_employee_to_ride_and_section(E,R,S), S="pink".

% 3.3 The person who served 100 riders is Herbert or Marc.
{E="Herbert"; E="Marc"}=1 :- assign_employee_to_ride_and_section(E,R,S), R=100.

% 4. Victor is either the employee who served 50 riders or the employee who works in the purple section.
{R=50; S="purple"}=1 :- assign_employee_to_ride_and_section(E,R,S), E="Victor".

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{N1=N2; L1=L2; PM1=PM2}=0 :- match(N1,L1,PM1), match(N2,L2,PM2), (N1,L1,PM1)!=(N2,L2,PM2).

% 1. The student who spoke for 12 minutes talked about Churchill.
L=12 :- match(N,L,PM), PM="Churchill".

% 2. Anita was either the presenter who spoke for 10 minutes or the presenter who gave the presentation on Gladstone.
{L=10; PM="Gladstone"}=1 :- match(N,L,PM), N="Anita".

% 3. Perry spoke 4 minutes more than the presenter who gave the presentation on Gladstone.
L1=L2+4 :- match(N1,L1,PM1), match(N2,L2,PM2), N1="Perry", PM2="Gladstone".

% 4. Colleen was either the presenter who spoke for 10 minutes or the student who gave the presentation on Gladstone.
{L=10; PM="Gladstone"}=1 :- match(N,L,PM), N="Colleen".

% 5. The presenter who gave the presentation on Chamberlain spoke 2 minutes less than Colleen.
L1=L2-2 :- match(N1,L1,PM1), match(N2,L2,PM2), PM1="Chamberlain", N2="Colleen".

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{P1=P2; Y1=Y2; Pos1=Pos2}=0 :- match_player(P1,Y1,Pos1), match_player(P2,Y2,Pos2), (P1,Y1,Pos1)!=(P2,Y2,Pos2).

% 1. Daregh started 6 years before the goalie.
Y1=Y2-6 :- match_player(P1,Y1,Pos1), match_player(P2,Y2,Pos2), P1="Daregh", Pos2="goalie".

% 2. The player who started in 1982 was either the goalie or Daregh.
{Pos="goalie"; P="Daregh"}=1 :- match_player(P,Y,Pos), Y=1982.

% 3. Awad began playing in 1985.
Y=1985 :- match_player(P,Y,Pos), P="Awad".

% 4. The player who started in 1976 was the sweeper.
Pos="sweeper" :- match_player(P,Y,Pos), Y=1976.

% 5. Gardelli was either the center back or the player who started in 1979.
{Pos="center back"; Y=1979}=1 :- match_player(P,Y,Pos), P="Gardelli".

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{N1=N2; P1=P2; D1=D2}=0 :- match(N1,P1,D1), match(N2,P2,D2), (N1,P1,D1)!=(N2,P2,D2).

% 1. Hope paid less than Delia.
P1<P2 :- match(N1,P1,D1), match(N2,P2,D2), N1="Hope", N2="Delia".

% 2. Patricia had the cappuccino.
D="cappuccino" :- match(N,P,D), N="Patricia".

% 3. The one who had the cafe americano paid 1 dollar more than Patricia.
P1=P2+1 :- match(N1,P1,D1), match(N2,P2,D2), D1="cafe americano", D2="cappuccino".

% 4. Hope paid more than the one who had the cafe americano.
P1>P2 :- match(N1,P1,D1), match(N2,P2,D2), N1="Hope", D2="cafe americano".

% 5. The one who had the chai tea paid 1 dollar more than the one who had the cafe americano.
P1=P2+1 :- match(N1,P1,D1), match(N2,P2,D2), D1="chai tea", D2="cafe americano".

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{D1=D2; M1=M2; Du1=Du2}=0 :- assign(D1,M1,Du1), assign(D2,M2,Du2), (D1,M1,Du1)!=(D2,M2,Du2).

% 1. Howell will leave sometime after Fitzgerald.
M1<M2 :- assign(D1,M1,Du1), assign(D2,M2,Du2), D1="Fitzgerald", D2="Howell".

% 2. Howell will leave sometime before the ambassador with the 6 day visit.
M1<M2 :- assign(D1,M1,Du1), assign(D2,M2,Du2), D1="Howell", Du2=6.

% 3. Vasquez will leave 1 month before the ambassador with the 2 day visit.
M1+1=M2 :- assign(D1,M1,Du1), assign(D2,M2,Du2), D1="Vasquez", Du2=2.

% 4. The ambassador with the 8 day visit will leave 2 months before Vasquez.
M1+2=M2 :- assign(D1,M1,Du1), assign(D2,M2,Du2), Du1=8, D2="Vasquez".

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{Crater1=Crater2; Diameter1=Diameter2; Period1=Period2}=0 :- match(Crater1,Diameter1,Period1), match(Crater2,Diameter2,Period2), (Crater1,Diameter1,Period1)!=(Crater2,Diameter2,Period2).

% 1. The Vorckin impact crater is 125 meters wide.
Diameter=125 :- match(Crater,Diameter,Period), Crater="Vorckin".

% 2. The 150 meters wide one is either the Ordovician impact crater or the Permian impact crater.
{Period="Ordovician"; Period="Permian"}=1 :- match(Crater,Diameter,Period), Diameter=150.

% 3. The Ordovician impact crater is 25 meters wider than the Jurassic impact crater.
Diameter1=Diameter2+25 :- match(Crater1,Diameter1,Period1), match(Crater2,Diameter2,Period2), Period1="Ordovician", Period2="Jurassic".

% 4. The Triassic impact crater is either the Ormagh impact crater or the 150 meters wide one.
{Crater="Ormagh"; Diameter=150}=1 :- match(Crater,Diameter,Period), Period="Triassic".

% 5. The Cersay impact crater was formed during the Jurassic period.
Period="Jurassic" :- match(Crater,Diameter,Period), Crater="Cersay".

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{R1=R2; T1=T2; C1=C2}=0 :- match(R1,T1,C1), match(R2,T2,C2), (R1,T1,C1)!=(R2,T2,C2).

% 1. Zachary wore the aquamarine shirt.
C="aquamarine" :- match(R,T,C), R="Zachary".

% 2. The contestant in the cyan shirt finished 1 minute after Franklin.
T1=T2+1 :- match(R1,T1,C1), match(R2,T2,C2), C1="cyan", R2="Franklin".

% 3. Zachary finished 2 minutes after Salvador.
T1=T2+2 :- match(R1,T1,C1), match(R2,T2,C2), R1="Zachary", R2="Salvador".

% 4. The contestant in the maroon shirt finished 1 minute before Salvador.
T1=T2-1 :- match(R1,T1,C1), match(R2,T2,C2), C1="maroon", R2="Salvador".

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{N1=N2; A1=A2; S1=S2}=0 :- match(N1,A1,S1), match(N2,A2,S2), (N1,A1,S1)!=(N2,A2,S2).

% 1. Kyle is 1 year older than Arlene.
A1=A2+1 :- match(N1,A1,S1), match(N2,A2,S2), N1="Kyle", N2="Arlene".

% 2. Kyle, the centenarian who is 109 years old and the person who is 110 years old are all different people.
N1!=N2 :- match(N1,A1,S1), match(N2,A2,S2), match(N3,A3,S3), N1="Kyle", A2=109, A3=110.
A1!=A2 :- match(N1,A1,S1), match(N2,A2,S2), match(N3,A3,S3), N1="Kyle", A2=109, A3=110.
N1!=N3 :- match(N1,A1,S1), match(N2,A2,S2), match(N3,A3,S3), N1="Kyle", A2=109, A3=110.
A1!=A3 :- match(N1,A1,S1), match(N2,A2,S2), match(N3,A3,S3), N1="Kyle", A2=109, A3=110.
N2!=N3 :- match(N1,A1,S1), match(N2,A2,S2), match(N3,A3,S3), N1="Kyle", A2=109, A3=110.
A2!=A3 :- match(N1,A1,S1), match(N2,A2,S2), match(N3,A3,S3), N1="Kyle", A2=109, A3=110.

% 3. The Pennsylvania native is older than Ernesto.
A1>A2 :- match(N1,A1,S1), match(N2,A2,S2), S1="Pennsylvania", N2="Ernesto".

% 4. Ernesto is older than the Louisiana native.
A1>A2 :- match(N1,A1,S1), match(N2,A2,S2), N1="Ernesto", S2="Louisiana".

% 5. The person who is 111 years old is a native of South Dakota.
S="South Dakota" :- match(N,A,S), A=111.

% No option in any category will ever be used more than once.
{P1=P2; S1=S2; C1=C2; H1=H2}=0 :- match_player(P1,S1,C1,H1), match_player(P2,S2,C2,H2), (P1,S1,C1,H1)!=(P2,S2,C2,H2).

% 1. Greg threw the red darts.
C="red" :- match_player(P,S,C,H), P="Greg".
